Module jtrim.image.transform
Package org.jtrim2.image.transform

Class ZoomToFitTransformationStep

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.image.transform.ZoomToFitTransformationStep
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageTransformationStep
public final class ZoomToFitTransformationStep extends Object implements ImageTransformationStep
Defines an ImageTransformationStep scaling the input image to fit the display.

Special cases:

  • If neither FIT_WIDTH, nor FIT_HEIGHT is specified, then the image is not scaled (i.e., the applied zoom property is 1.0).
  • If exactly one of FIT_WIDTH and FIT_HEIGHT is specified, then the aspect ratio is honored unless the absence of MAY_MAGNIFY requires that the applied zoomX or zoomY must not exceed 1.0.
  • If MAY_MAGNIFY is not specified, then neither the applied zoomX, nor the zoomY can be greater than 1.0. They will be reduced accordingly (if KEEP_ASPECT_RATIO is not set, then only the offending one will be reduced to 1.0).

Note: The transformation is applied to the input image (i.e.: TransformationStepInput.getInputImage().

Thread safety

Instances of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this interface are not synchronization transparent and calling them while holding a lock should be avoided.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ZoomToFitTransformationStep

      public ZoomToFitTransformationStep(BasicImageTransformations transBase, Set<ZoomToFitOption> options, Color bckgColor, InterpolationType interpolationType)
      Creates a new ZoomToFitTransformationStep with the specified properties.
      Parameters:
      transBase - the additional transformations to be applied to the input image. The scaling and offset property of this BasicImageTransformations are ignored. This argument cannot be null.
      options - the rules to be applied for scaling the image. This argument and its elements cannot be null. The content of this set is copied and no reference to the set will be kept by the newly created instance.
      bckgColor - the Color to set the pixels of the destination image to where no pixels of the input image are transformed. This argument cannot be null.
      interpolationType - the interpolation algorithm to be used when transforming the input image. This argument cannot be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

  • Method Details

    • getBasicTransformations

      public static BasicImageTransformations getBasicTransformations(int inputWidth, int inputHeight, int destWidth, int destHeight, Set<ZoomToFitOption> options, BasicImageTransformations transBase)
      Returns the image transformations required to be applied to an image to fit a display with the particular size. The transformation assumes that (0, 0) offset means, that the center of the image is displayed at the center of the display.

      Special cases: See the class definition for special cases of the zoom to fit options.

      Note that ZoomToFitTransformationStep will use the transformation returned by this method, so you may use this method to check what transformation would the transformation use.

      Parameters:
      inputWidth - the width of the image to be scaled to fit the display. If this argument is less or equal to zero, an identity transformation is returned.
      inputHeight - the height of the image to be scaled to fit the display. If this argument is less or equal to zero, an identity transformation is returned.
      destWidth - the width of display, the input image needs to fit. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
      destHeight - the height of display, the input image needs to fit. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
      options - the rules to be applied for scaling the image. This argument cannot be null.
      transBase - the additional transformations to be applied to the input image. The scaling and offset property of this BasicImageTransformations are ignored. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the image transformations required to be applied to an image to fit a display with the particular size. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified destination width or height is less than zero
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

    • render

      public TransformedImage render(CancellationToken cancelToken, TransformationStepInput input, BufferedImage offeredBuffer)
      Applies the rendering defined by this ImageTransformationStep. This method should usually apply the transformation on the image produced by the previous transformation step (i.e.: input.getInputImage()).

      If this transformation is the first in the sequence, then the input for this transformation is the same as the source image.

      Callers of this method may provide a BufferedImage which this method may use to render its output to. Implementations are free to ignore the offered BufferedImage but for best performance, they should use it instead of creating a new equivalent buffer. Note however, that they must not retain a reference themselves to this buffer after the render method returns.

      Specified by:
      render in interface ImageTransformationStep
      Parameters:
      cancelToken - the CancellationToken which might signal, that the result of this rendering is no longer needed. If this rendering process can take for more than a few hundred milliseconds, implementations are recommended to check for cancellation. This argument cannot be null.
      input - the input for this transformation. If you want to further transform the output of the previous transformation, then you should use input.getInputImage(). This argument cannot be null.
      offeredBuffer - the BufferedImage which implementation might use to render their output to. This method is free to ignore this argument. If implementation chooses to render its output to this BufferedImage, it should also return offeredBuffer in its result. This argument can be null, in which case implementations are forced to create a new BufferedImage as needed.
      Returns:
      the output of the transformation which will be the input for the next transformation; or if there is no more transformation, the actual output of the rendering chain. This method may never return null. The pointTransformer property of the result must be relative to the result of the previous transformation step and not to the original source image.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the string representation of this transformation in no particular format

      This method is intended to be used for debugging only.

      Overrides:
